Container.Name: zap2xml
Container.Description: zap2xml is a small and fast command line script that connects to a Zap2it or TVGuide account, downloads the tv listings data, and converts it to XMLTV or XTVD formatted .xml. [br][br][b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] : Folder where all zap2xml config files, config templates and download cache [br] [b]/downloads[/b] : Folder where the guide.xml file will be written [br] [br]On first launch, zap2xml will not scrape guide data. A configuration template will be downloaded to [b]/config/templates/zap2xml.conf.template[/b]. Copy/rename this file to [b]/config/zap2xml.conf[/b] and edit per your needs:[br] [br][b]user=[span style='color: #E80000;']*zap2it.com_username*[/span][/b]-------- change to your zap2it username [br][b]pass=[span style='color: #E80000;']*zap2it.com_password*[/span][/b]-------- change to your zap2it username [br][b]cache=[span style='color: #E80000;']/config/cache[/span][/b]-------- zap2xml cache folder [br][b]days=[span style='color: #E80000;']14[/span][/b]-------- # of days of guide data to download [br][b]outformat=[span style='color: #E80000;']xmltv[/span][/b]-------- XML format [br][b]outfile=[span style='color: #E80000;']/data/guide.xml[/span][/b]-------- where to write guide.xml (usually same folder specified in THV container)[br] [br]Once you have made your configuration changes, you can restart the container. On the next (and each subsequent) launch, zap2xml will scrape zap2it.com for guide data and write it to the location specified in the configuration file.
